did.abstract: Officer with the 6th Michigan Infantry and Heavy Artillery Regiment during the Civil War; personal papers relating to wartime service and accumulated records of the 6th Michigan Heavy Artillery.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The originals of this microfilmed collection came from Howell Taylor (donor no. 2115) and the Washtenaw County Historical Society (donor no. 945).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

originalsloc.p: The originals of the microfilmed material are located at the Bentley Historical Library.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Seymour Howell papers [microform], Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Seymour Howell was a businessman from Saline, Michigan. During the Civil War he served as paymaster with the 6th Michigan Infantry and Heavy Artillery Regiment.

scopecontent.p: The microfilm collection of the papers of Seymour Howell have been brought together from two separate collections: papers donated by the family and records which Howell himself donated to the Washtenaw County Historical Society and which subsequently have been deposited with the Bentley Historical Library. The collection from the family includes more personal items: a diary, a wartime notebook, letters, photographs, and a scrapbook. The Howell papers from the Washtenaw County Historical Society consist almost entirely of records of the 6th Michigan Artillery maintained by Howell. These include invoices, receipts, requisitions, ordnance reports and communications, and orders.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Michigan Artillery Regiment, 6th (1863-1865). Company F.

did.unittitle: Diary, letters, and other war-related materials

note.p: (these are papers donated to the library by a Howell family member)

did.unittitle: Civil War discharge and military commissions, 1861-1865
Charles S. Howell naturalization and Civil War papers

note.p: (These are papers accumulated by Seymour Howell and deposited with the Washtenaw County Historical Society; the files now form part of the collected historical materials of the WCHS and have been placed on deposit with the Bentley Historical Library)

did.unittitle: Invoices of ordnance and ordnance stores
Receipts of clothes, and camp and garrison equipment, 1864-1865
Reports on the returns of clothing, camp and garrison equipage, 1864
Report of quarterly return of ordnance and ordnance stores, 1864-1865
General orders of the War Dept., 1863-1865
Printed communications of the Ordnance Office, 1863-1864
Official communications of the Ordnance Office, 1864-1866
List of articles received by Seymour Howell at Fort Gaines, Ala., 1865
Proceedings of board of survey at Fort Gaines, Ala., 1865
Abstracts of expenditures at Fort Gaines, Ala., 1863-1865

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The library also has other materials from the Seymour Howell collection which were not microfilmed because they were unrelated to his wartime service. These include diaries, 1873-1904, and several artifacts from the war.
